intro: Tithymalus luridus, commonly known as the lurid tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, this plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family, with a unique appearance that aids in its identification.
